skill.name: paypal-integration
skill.description: Integrate PayPal payment processing with support for express checkout, subscriptions, and refund management. Use when implementing PayPal payments, processing online transactions, or building e-commerce checkout flows.
skill.summary: Integrate PayPal payment processing with support for express checkout, subscriptions, and refund man...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill providing PayPal integration guidance. All static findings are false positives: 'C2 keywords' refers to PayPal credential variables (client_id, client_secret); 'weak cryptographic algorithm' are scanner artifacts; 'Ruby/shell backtick execution' are markdown code block delimiters. Network URLs are legitimate PayPal API endpoints expected in payment documentation.

content.value_statement: You need a reliable PayPal payment flow that handles checkout, subscriptions, and refunds. This skill provides clear steps for API calls, IPN verification, and sandbox testing.
actual_capabilities: Explain PayPal Smart Buttons setup with client and server capture
Describe order creation, capture, and order detail REST calls
Outline IPN verification and processing steps
Show subscription plan and subscription creation flow
Describe refund creation and refund detail retrieval
Provide error handling and sandbox testing guidance
limitations: Does not provide PayPal credentials or create accounts
Does not run or deploy code in your environment
Does not replace official PayPal SDK documentation
Does not cover legal or tax compliance requirements

use_cases.title: Add checkout flow
use_cases.description: Map client button setup, server order creation, and capture verification.

use_cases.title: Plan recurring billing
use_cases.description: Define plan creation, subscription approval, and renewal handling.

use_cases.title: Handle refunds and disputes
use_cases.description: Document refund creation, chargeback handling, and status checks.

prompt_templates.title: Quick start checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a concise checklist for adding PayPal Smart Buttons and server side capture verification.

prompt_templates.title: IPN verification steps
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline the IPN verification flow and idempotency checks for a Flask backend.

prompt_templates.title: Subscriptions API flow
prompt_templates.prompt: List the API steps to create a product, plan, and subscription, and return the approval URL.

prompt_templates.title: Refund workflow design
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe the server steps to issue a partial refund and retrieve refund details.

output_examples.input: Provide a PayPal IPN verification checklist.
output: Receive POST data and preserve all fields
POST back to the PayPal IPN endpoint
Log and ignore duplicate transaction IDs

output_examples.input: How do I create a subscription plan?
output: Create a product first via the Products API
Define a billing plan with pricing and cycle details
Activate the plan to make it available
Create a subscription using the plan ID
Redirect the subscriber to the approval URL

output_examples.input: What are common PayPal checkout mistakes?
output: Trusting client callbacks without server verification
Processing IPN messages without checking for duplicates
Using sandbox credentials in production environment
Not handling all payment states (completed, refunded, charged back)
Hardcoding values instead of using configuration

best_practices: Verify IPN messages before processing any payment action
Use sandbox mode for all testing before production deployment
Make endpoints and credentials configurable via environment variables
anti_patterns: Trusting client callbacks without server verification
Processing IPN messages without idempotency checks

faq.question: Is this compatible with the PayPal REST API?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance uses PayPal REST endpoints for checkout, subscriptions, and refunds.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and patterns only. It does not run code or configure your PayPal account.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing backend?
faq.answer: Yes. The steps are framework agnostic and can be adapted to your stack.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. It does not access files, credentials, or external systems.

faq.question: What should I check if IPN verification fails?
faq.answer: Check endpoint URLs, required parameters, and network errors, then retry in sandbox.

faq.question: How does this compare to PayPal SDKs?
faq.answer: It explains flows and patterns, while SDKs provide runnable client libraries.
